children: {"type":"div","key":"k0Outbreaks linked to vaccine-preventable diseases","ref":null,"props":{"children":["Outbreaks linked to vaccine-preventable diseases",{"type":"span","key":null,"ref":null,"props":{"children":", "},"_owner":null}]},"_owner":null}

neodash_threat_text: Emerging infectious diseases or novel pathogens

neodash_threat_text_display.key: k1Emerging infectious diseases or novel pathogens

children: Emerging infectious diseases or novel pathogens

parameters.neodash_my_question: Where  and when the event happened?
parameters.neodash_time_and_place: When and where the events happened?
parameters.neodash_impact_on_people: Is it infectious? How intensive is it?
parameters.neodash_severity_and_urgency: How severe is it and how soon should we take some action?

reports.title: Start date
reports.query: RETURN true;

reports.title: End date
reports.query: RETURN true;

reports.title: Threats to be detected - Alice's assignment
reports.query:
MATCH (n:`Threat`) 
WHERE toLower(toString(n.`text`)) CONTAINS toLower($input) 
RETURN DISTINCT n.`text` as value,  n.`text` as display ORDER BY size(toString(value)) ASC LIMIT 5

reports.title: Clusters with detected threats
reports.query:
WITH CASE WHEN TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) > TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) THEN TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) + '-' + TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) ELSE TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) END AS period
WITH period + '-\\d+' AS id_pattern
  MATCH (c:Cluster)-[r:DETECTED_THREAT]->(t:Threat)
    WHERE c.id =~ id_pattern
      AND t.text IN $neodash_threat_text
RETURN c, r, t

reports.title: Cluster by identifier
reports.query:
MATCH (n:`Cluster`) 
WHERE toLower(toString(n.`id`)) CONTAINS toLower($input) 
RETURN DISTINCT n.`id` as value,  n.`id` as display ORDER BY size(toString(value)) ASC LIMIT 5

reports.title: Articles
reports.query:
MATCH (a:Article)-[r1:IN_CLUSTER]->(c:Cluster {id: $neodash_cluster_id})
RETURN a.title AS title, a.pub_name AS publisher, a.pub_date AS date, a.content AS content, a.factiva_folder AS factiva, a.gphin_score AS score, a.gphin_state AS state

reports.title: Clusters without detected threats
reports.query:
WITH CASE WHEN TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) > TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) THEN TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) + '-' + TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) ELSE TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) END AS period
WITH period + '-\\d+' AS id_pattern
MATCH (c:Cluster)
  WHERE c.id =~ id_pattern
    AND NOT EXISTS((c)-[:DETECTED_THREAT]->(:Threat))
RETURN c

reports.title: Summary
reports.query:
MATCH ((c:Cluster {id: $neodash_cluster_id}))
RETURN TRIM(c.summary)

reports.title: Detected threats
reports.query:
MATCH (c:Cluster {id: $neodash_cluster_id})-[r2:DETECTED_THREAT]->(t:Threat) 
RETURN t.text AS threat

reports.title: Q&A
reports.query:
MATCH (c:Cluster {id: $neodash_cluster_id})
WITH c, apoc.convert.fromJsonMap(c.answers) AS qa_map
WITH c, qa_map, KEYS(qa_map) AS questions
  UNWIND questions as question
RETURN question AS Question, qa_map[question] as Answer

reports.title: Articles in the cluster
reports.query:
MERGE (d:DayCounter)
  DELETE d
WITH 1 AS dummy
  MATCH (a:Article)-[r:IN_CLUSTER]->(c:Cluster {id: $neodash_cluster_id})
WITH c, COLLECT(a) AS ac
WITH ac
  OPTIONAL MATCH (a)-[r:SIMILAR_TO]-(oa)
    WHERE a IN ac AND oa IN ac
RETURN a, r, oa

reports.title: Cluster's label and number of articles within Alice's assignment
reports.query:
WITH CASE WHEN TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) > TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) THEN TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) + '-' + TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) ELSE TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) END AS period
WITH period + '-\\d+' AS id_pattern
  MATCH (t:Threat)<-[r:DETECTED_THREAT]-(c:Cluster)<-[:IN_CLUSTER]-(a:Article)
    WHERE c.id =~ id_pattern
      AND t.text IN $neodash_threat_text
WITH DISTINCT(c) AS c, COUNT(DISTINCT(a)) AS nr_articles
RETURN c.title AS label, c.id AS id, [i IN RANGE(1, SIZE(c.labels)) | c.labels[i]] AS alternatives, nr_articles ORDER BY nr_articles DESC

reports.title: Clusters without detected threats
reports.query:
WITH CASE WHEN TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) > TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) THEN TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) + '-' + TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) ELSE TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) END AS period
WITH period + '-\\d+' AS id_pattern
  MATCH (c:Cluster)<-[:IN_CLUSTER]-(a:Article)
    WHERE c.id =~ id_pattern
      AND NOT EXISTS((c)-[:DETECTED_THREAT]->(:Threat))
WITH DISTINCT(c) AS c, COUNT(a) AS nr_articles
RETURN c.title AS cluster, [i IN RANGE(1, SIZE(c.labels)) | c.labels[i]] AS alternatives, nr_articles ORDER BY nr_articles DESC

reports.title: Top 10 possible diseases in outliers
reports.query:
MATCH (o:Outlier)
  WHERE o.pub_date = DATE($neodash_start_date)
    AND o.disease_question STARTS WITH 'Yes'
    AND NOT apoc.convert.fromJsonMap(o.answers)['What disease is mentioned?'] STARTS WITH 'No disease'
    AND NOT apoc.convert.fromJsonMap(o.answers)['What disease is mentioned?'] STARTS WITH 'No specific'
    AND NOT apoc.convert.fromJsonMap(o.answers)['What disease is mentioned?'] STARTS WITH 'Unclear'
WITH o, apoc.convert.fromJsonMap(o.answers) AS answer_map
RETURN answer_map['What disease is mentioned?'] AS possible_disease, COUNT(distinct(o)) AS count ORDER BY count DESC LIMIT 10

reports.title: Outliers with possible diseases
reports.query:
MATCH (o:Outlier)
  WHERE o.pub_date = DATE($neodash_start_date)
    AND o.disease_question STARTS WITH 'Yes'
WITH o, apoc.convert.fromJsonMap(o.answers) AS answer_map
  WHERE NOT (answer_map['What disease is mentioned?']) STARTS WITH 'No disease'
    AND NOT apoc.convert.fromJsonMap(o.answers)['What disease is mentioned?'] STARTS WITH 'No specific'
    AND NOT apoc.convert.fromJsonMap(o.answers)['What disease is mentioned?'] STARTS WITH 'Unclear'
RETURN o.id AS id, o.title AS title, answer_map['What disease is mentioned?'] AS possible_disease, o.gphin_score AS score, o.gphin_state AS state ORDER BY state ASC, score DESC

reports.title: Map of development
reports.query:
MATCH (c:Cluster {id: $neodash_cluster_id})
WITH c, c.countries AS countries
  UNWIND countries AS country
RETURN country, COUNT(DISTINCT(c.id)) AS spread

reports.title: Outliers
reports.query:
MATCH (o:Outlier)
  WHERE o.pub_date = DATE($neodash_start_date)
    AND o.disease_question STARTS WITH 'Yes'
    AND NOT apoc.convert.fromJsonMap(o.answers)['What disease is mentioned?'] STARTS WITH 'No disease'
    AND NOT apoc.convert.fromJsonMap(o.answers)['What disease is mentioned?'] STARTS WITH 'No specific'
    AND NOT apoc.convert.fromJsonMap(o.answers)['What disease is mentioned?'] STARTS WITH 'Unclear'
WITH o, apoc.convert.fromJsonMap(o.answers) AS answer_map
RETURN o

reports.title: Outlier analysis (for the daily view or the first day in the period only)
reports.query:
- Graph view: highlight articles with one of 'Wuhan', 'pneumonia', 'coronavirus' in title
- Top 10 possible diseases based on question answering. *Note that the output are grouped by content without deduplication*
- List of outliers with title, possible disease, GPHIN score, and action taken.

reports.title: Period view
reports.query:
- See all clusters of articles formed over a period of time from *start date* to *end date* (*if end date less than start date then it is consider as a single day view*)
- Threat list: what are the public health threats that are assigned to Alice. All clusters are classified against them. Multiple threats can be detected in a single cluster.
- Graph view of clusters and threats. Bigger clusters have more articles. Red cluster highlight special matches of keywords (Wuhan, pneumonia, coronavirus)
- Cluster's label, alternative labels, and number of articles
- Clusters with full hierarchical to show how *close* are the cluster to ech other. For example how clusters with disease outbreaks belong to the same subtrees.
  * Three views: all together, only with deteched threats, and only for Alice
- World map view of clusters (detected locations - city, province, building, etc - *not perfect*)
- Clusters without detected threats (*perhaps not of interest*)
  * Their labels, and number of articles

reports.title: World map of clusters with detected threats
reports.query:
WITH CASE WHEN TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) > TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) THEN TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) + '-' + TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) ELSE TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) END AS period
WITH period + '-\\d+' AS id_pattern
  MATCH (c:Cluster)-[r:DETECTED_THREAT]->(t:Threat)
    WHERE c.id =~ id_pattern
      AND t.text IN $neodash_threat_text
WITH c, apoc.convert.fromJsonList(c.locations) AS locations
  UNWIND locations AS l
WITH c.id AS id, c.title AS label,
	CASE WHEN VALUETYPE(l.latitude) = 'MAP NOT NULL' THEN l.latitude[KEYS(l.latitude)[0]] ELSE TOFLOAT(l.latitude) END AS lat,
	CASE WHEN VALUETYPE(l.longitude) = 'MAP NOT NULL' THEN l.longitude[KEYS(l.longitude)[0]] ELSE TOFLOAT(l.longitude) END AS lng  
RETURN {id: id, label: label, point: POINT({latitude: lat, longitude: lng})}

reports.title: Use the first representative article to answer my second question
reports.query:
MATCH (c:Cluster {id: $neodash_cluster_id}) 
WITH c
  MATCH (a:Article)
    WHERE a.id IN c.representative_docs
WITH COLLECT(a.content) AS contents
WITH REDUCE(t='', d IN contents | CASE WHEN SIZE(d) > SIZE(t) AND t <> '' THEN t ELSE d END) AS fulltext
WITH fulltext
  CALL apoc.load.jsonParams(
    "http://34.118.173.82:8000/answer_question", 
    {method: "POST", `Content-Type`:"application/json"}, 
    apoc.convert.toJson({fulltext: fulltext, question: $neodash_impact_on_people})) YIELD value 
RETURN value['answer'] AS answer

reports.title: Cluster analysis
reports.query:
- Cluster can be selected by id: `YYYY-MM-DD-<cluster-id>` where `cluster_id` is the identification of the cluster in the period.
- Summary: short summarization based on aggregated content of (3, 5, or 10) *representative documents* of the clusters
- Detected threats: public health threats identified within articles of the cluster
- Map of development: which countries are being effected.
- Q&A: common question and answers

reports.title: More exploration - my first question
reports.query: RETURN true;

reports.title: Use summary to answer my first question
reports.query:
MATCH (c:Cluster {id: $neodash_cluster_id}) 
WITH c
  CALL apoc.load.jsonParams(
    "http://34.118.173.82:8000/answer_question", 
    {method: "POST", `Content-Type`:"application/json"}, 
    apoc.convert.toJson({fulltext: c.summary, question: $neodash_time_and_place})) YIELD value 
RETURN value['answer'] AS answer

reports.title: More exploration - my second question
reports.query: RETURN true;

reports.title: More exploration - my third question
reports.query: RETURN true;

reports.title: Use the top three representative articles to answer my third question
reports.query:
MATCH (c:Cluster {id: $neodash_cluster_id}) 
WITH c
  MATCH (a:Article)
    WHERE a.id IN c.representative_docs
WITH COLLECT(a.content) AS contents
WITH [i IN RANGE(0, CASE WHEN SIZE(contents) > 2 THEN 2 ELSE SIZE(contents) END) | contents[i]] AS contents
WITH REDUCE(t='', e IN contents | CASE WHEN t = '' THEN e ELSE t + '\n\n' + e END) AS fulltext
WITH fulltext
  CALL apoc.load.jsonParams(
    "http://34.118.173.82:8000/answer_question", 
    {method: "POST", `Content-Type`:"application/json"}, 
    apoc.convert.toJson({fulltext: fulltext, question: $neodash_severity_and_urgency})) YIELD value 
RETURN value['answer'] AS answer

reports.title: Chat with AI
reports.query:
- Asking three different question, using summary of the cluster, its first representative article, its top three articles to answer
- **You can ask what you want!** *Type your question!*

reports.title: What does Alice read? Only the clusters and the outliers associated with threats assigned to her.
reports.query:
WITH CASE WHEN TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) > TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) THEN TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) + '-' + TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) ELSE TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) END AS period
WITH period + '-\\d+' AS id_pattern
  MATCH (t:Threat)<-[r:DETECTED_THREAT]-(c:Cluster)<-[:IN_CLUSTER]-(a:Article)
    WHERE c.id =~ id_pattern
      AND t.text IN $neodash_threat_text
WITH COUNT(DISTINCT(c)) AS t_clusters, COUNT(DISTINCT(a)) AS t_articles, id_pattern
  MATCH (c:Cluster)<-[:IN_CLUSTER]-(a:Article)
    WHERE c.id =~ id_pattern
WITH COUNT(DISTINCT(c)) AS a_clusters, COUNT(DISTINCT(a)) AS c_articles, t_clusters, t_articles
  MATCH (a:Article)
    WHERE CASE WHEN ($neodash_end_date IS NOT NULL AND $neodash_end_date >= $neodash_start_date)
      THEN  ($neodash_start_date <= a.pub_date AND a.pub_date <= $neodash_end_date)
      ELSE ($neodash_start_date = a.pub_date) END
WITH
  COUNT(DISTINCT(a)) AS a_articles, c_articles, a_clusters, t_articles, t_clusters
  MATCH (a:Article:Outlier)
    WHERE CASE WHEN ($neodash_end_date IS NOT NULL AND $neodash_end_date >= $neodash_start_date)
      THEN  ($neodash_start_date <= a.pub_date AND a.pub_date <= $neodash_end_date)
      ELSE ($neodash_start_date = a.pub_date) END
WITH
  a_articles, c_articles, a_clusters, t_articles, t_clusters, COUNT(DISTINCT(a)) AS o_articles
RETURN
  a_articles AS `#articles`, 
  c_articles AS `#clustered articles`,
  a_clusters AS `#clusters`, 
  t_articles AS `#articles (T)`,
  t_clusters AS `#clusters (T)`,
  o_articles AS `#outliers (T)`,
  (t_clusters + o_articles) AS `#Alice reads`,
  TOSTRING(ROUND(10000.0*t_clusters/a_articles)/100.0) +'%' AS `Clusters`,
  TOSTRING(ROUND(10000.0*o_articles/a_articles)/100.0) +'%' AS `+Outliers`

reports.title: All clusters in full hierarchy
reports.query:
WITH CASE WHEN TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) > TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) THEN TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) + '-' + TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) ELSE TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) END AS period
WITH period + '-\\d+' AS id_pattern
  MATCH (c:Cluster)
    WHERE c.id =~ id_pattern
WITH c 
  MATCH path=(c)<-[:CONTAINS*..]-(h:HierarchicalCluster)
RETURN path

reports.title: Only clusters with detected threats in full hierarchy
reports.query:
WITH CASE WHEN TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) > TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) THEN TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) + '-' + TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) ELSE TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) END AS period
WITH period + '-\\d+' AS id_pattern
  MATCH (c:Cluster)-[:DETECTED_THREAT]->(t:Threat)
    WHERE c.id =~ id_pattern
WITH c 
  MATCH path=(c)<-[:CONTAINS*..]-(h:HierarchicalCluster)
RETURN path

reports.title: Only Alice's clusters in full hierarchy
reports.query:
WITH CASE WHEN TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) > TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) THEN TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) + '-' + TOSTRING($neodash_end_date) ELSE TOSTRING($neodash_start_date) END AS period
WITH period + '-\\d+' AS id_pattern
  MATCH (c:Cluster)-[:DETECTED_THREAT]->(t:Threat)
    WHERE c.id =~ id_pattern
      AND t.text IN $neodash_threat_text
WITH c 
  MATCH path=(c)<-[:CONTAINS*..]-(h:HierarchicalCluster)
RETURN path

reports.title: Changes in time
reports.query:
- The graph diagrams below show how the articles of *the cluster with id selected above* and their similarities evolve over time
- Click on the *refresh* `circle` on the left of **Date (in the middle diagram)** to change the diagram in the midile

reports.title: Articles at the start of the period
reports.query:
MATCH (a:Article)-[r:IN_CLUSTER]->(c:Cluster {id: $neodash_cluster_id})
WITH c, COLLECT(a) AS ac
WITH ac, SPLIT($neodash_cluster_id, '-') AS splits
WITH ac, DATE(splits[0] + '-' + splits[1] + '-' + splits[2]) AS start_date
  OPTIONAL MATCH (a)-[r:SIMILAR_TO]-(oa)
    WHERE a IN ac AND start_date = a.pub_date AND oa IN ac AND start_date = oa.pub_date
RETURN a, r, oa

reports.title: Start date
reports.query:
WITH SPLIT($neodash_cluster_id, '-') AS splits
WITH splits, DATE(splits[0] + '-' + splits[1] + '-' + splits[2]) AS start_date
RETURN start_date

reports.title: Articles at the end of the period
reports.query:
MATCH (a:Article)-[r:IN_CLUSTER]->(c:Cluster {id: $neodash_cluster_id})
WITH c, COLLECT(a) AS ac
  OPTIONAL MATCH (a)-[r:SIMILAR_TO]-(oa)
    WHERE a IN ac AND oa IN ac
RETURN a, r, oa

reports.title: Keywords
reports.query:
MATCH (c:Cluster {id: $neodash_cluster_id})
RETURN c.keywords AS keywords

reports.title: Articles at a day within the period (to change see above right)
reports.query:
MATCH (a:Article)-[r:IN_CLUSTER]->(c:Cluster {id: $neodash_cluster_id})
WITH c, COLLECT(a) AS ac
WITH ac
  MERGE (d:DayCounter)

WITH ac, d.mid_date AS end_date
  OPTIONAL MATCH (a)-[r:SIMILAR_TO]-(oa)
    WHERE a IN ac AND end_date >= a.pub_date AND oa IN ac AND end_date >= oa.pub_date
RETURN a, r, oa

reports.title: Date - middle diagram
reports.query:
WITH SPLIT($neodash_cluster_id, '-') AS splits
WITH splits, DATE(splits[0] + '-' + splits[1] + '-' + splits[2]) AS start_date
WITH splits, start_date,
	CASE WHEN SIZE(splits) >= 4 
		THEN DATE(splits[3] + '-' + splits[4] + '-' + splits[5]) 
		ELSE start_date END AS end_date
WITH start_date, end_date, DURATION.inDays(start_date, end_date) AS days
	MERGE (d:DayCounter)
		SET d.mid_date = 
			CASE WHEN end_date IS NULL OR d.mid_date IS NULL
			THEN 
                CASE WHEN end_date > start_date
                    THEN start_date + DURATION({days:1})
                    ELSE start_date END
			ELSE
                CASE WHEN end_date > start_date
                    THEN 
                        CASE WHEN d.mid_date = end_date - DURATION({days:1})
                            THEN start_date + DURATION({days:1})
                            ELSE d.mid_date + DURATION({days:1}) END
        			ELSE d.mid_date
        		END
		    END
RETURN d.mid_date

reports.title: End date
reports.query:
WITH SPLIT($neodash_cluster_id, '-') AS splits
WITH splits, DATE(splits[0] + '-' + splits[1] + '-' + splits[2]) AS start_date
WITH splits, start_date, CASE WHEN SIZE(splits) = 4 
  THEN start_date 
  ELSE DATE(splits[3] + '-' + splits[4] + '-' + splits[5])
  END AS end_date
RETURN end_date

reports.title: Ontology with the first three levels
reports.query:
MATCH (o:Ontology)-[r1]-(d:Resource:Class)<-[r2:subClassOf*1..3]-(m:Resource:Class)
  WHERE m.label IS NOT NULL
RETURN o, r1, d, r2, m

reports.title: Disease
reports.query:
MATCH (n:`Class`) 
WHERE toLower(toString(n.`label`)) CONTAINS toLower($input) 
RETURN DISTINCT n.`label` as value,  n.`label` as display ORDER BY size(toString(value)) ASC LIMIT 5

reports.title: Superclasses
reports.query:
MATCH (d:Class {label: $neodash_class_label})-[r:subClassOf*1..]->(m:Class)
  WHERE m.label IS NOT NULL
RETURN d, r, m

reports.title: Subclasses (3 levels down)
reports.query:
MATCH (d:Class {label: $neodash_class_label})<-[r:subClassOf*1..3]-(m:Class)
  WHERE m.label IS NOT NULL
RETURN d, r, m

reports.title: Detected Diseases
reports.query:
MATCH (a:DON)<-[r1:PART_OF]-(c1:Chunk)-[rs:SIMILAR_D2D_CHUNK]->(c2:Chunk)-[r2:PART_OF]->(d:Resource:Class)<-[rd:DETECTED_DISEASE]-(a)
RETURN a, r1, c1, rs, c2, r2, d, rd

reports.title: Threat Graph
reports.query:
MATCH (d)<-[r1:DETECTED_DISEASE]-(n:DON)-[r2:DETECTED_THREAT]->(t:Threat)
RETURN n, r2, t, r1, d

reports.title: Distribution of threats (in Disease Outbreak News)
reports.query:
MATCH (n:DON)-[r:DETECTED_THREAT]-(t:Threat)
RETURN DISTINCT(t.text) AS threat, COUNT(n) AS count ORDER BY count DESC

reports.title: Map
reports.query:
MATCH (d:Resource:Class {label: $neodash_disease_label})
WITH d MATCH (n:DON)-[:DETECTED_DISEASE]->(d)
WITH n, n.countries AS countries
  UNWIND countries AS country
RETURN DISTINCT(country) AS code, COUNT(n) AS count

reports.title: Detected disease
reports.query:
MATCH (d:Resource:Class)-[:DETECTED_DISEASE]-(:DON)
RETURN DISTINCT(d.label)
